title: Renewable Power Grows Strongly, Despite the Pandemic
summary: Sources of renewable energy are expected together to be the main generators of electricity by 2025, eclipsing coal, the International Energy Agency said.

title: California Is Trying to Jump-Start the Hydrogen Economy
summary: The fuel could play an important role in fighting climate change, but it has been slow to gain traction because of high costs.

title: Dividends Are Down, but They Are Vastly Better Than Expected
summary: After predictions of cuts of 20 percent or more, stock dividends have been surprisingly resilient. Low interest rates have helped to keep companies flush with cash.

title: Exxon Mobil cuts billions in capital spending as oil and gas prices remain low.
Oil Refineries See Profit in Turning Kitchen Grease Into Diesel
summary: Struggling energy companies are increasing the production of renewable diesel, which can reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: OPEC and Russia Reach Deal to Raise Oil Production
summary: Oil producers in the OPEC Plus group reached a compromise on a modest production increase, but the talks revealed strains in the group.

title: In Blue States and Red, Pandemic Upends Public Services and Jobs
summary: As a standoff over federal aid persists, state and local governments are making deep budget cuts. “Everything’s going to slow down,” one official said.

title: Big Push Into Helium Could Have the World on Russia’s String
summary: It’s not just party balloons. A huge Siberian production plant is expected to reshape the market for a gas that’s essential to many critical industries.

title: A New Orleans Tower Anchors a City’s Riverfront Ambitions
summary: The World Trade Center, an X-shaped office tower that has sat empty since 2011, is at the heart of plans to revitalize the area along the Mississippi River.

title: General Electric will pay $200 million to settle claims it misled investors.
‘Is Exxon a Survivor?’ The Oil Giant Is at a Crossroads.
summary: Exxon Mobil is struggling to find its footing as demand for oil and gas falls and world leaders and businesses pledge to fight climate change.

title: Argentina to Allow Medicinal Marijuana to Be Grown at Home
summary: The new regulation also orders insurance providers to cover cannabis products prescribed by doctors. Some of the strongest champions of the government’s move were mothers of sick children.

title: Biden Wants to Rejoin Iran Nuclear Deal, but It Won’t Be Easy
summary: President Trump is applying more sanctions on Iran that would be hard to reverse. Tehran, facing elections in June, has its own demands.

title: Valéry Giscard d’Estaing, 94, Is Dead; Struggled to Transform France
summary: As a conservative president, he sought to make government more responsive to the people but was thwarted by an economic slowdown, demographic shifts and an imperious bearing. He died of Covid-19.
